text: A longer reach and a weightier swing make these men slightly more deadly than their shorter counterparts.
The spirit of Cú Chulainn is said to inhabit the noblest of Gaelic Warriors.
As mysterious as they are ferocious, Odin's Chosen strike fear into the hearts of mere mortals.
For those always on the move, scouting ahead of the army is as natural as sleeping.
Aristocratic warriors of Northanhymbran lands, albeit somewhat nonplussed about their new King.
Thirsty for honour and plunder, they come to the battle with a ferocity matched by few.
Men of the field and soil will fight under orders, as servants to the cause of their people.
Equipped with heavy throwing spears, these lesser nobles are as solid in defence as the mountains of their homelands.
We may be Lords of a new land but we will always rely on those who can fight with stout hearts on the sea.
These petty nobles' armour, while valuable, is unneeded, for their skill with a blade protects them.
Keen senses and unmatched speed are perfect for chasing down the newest additions to our slave pens.
The king's hand-picked soldiers stand ready to defend burghs at a moment's notice.
Deftly wielding spears, they will seek their fortune and the favours of their king.
To hunt well a man must know his ground and his quarry... the most successful of which can lead others as well.
Trying to chase down the swiftest mounts in the land is more likely to catch a javelin in your eye.
When men from the Fianna band step onto the battlefield, the enemy will know they face a united Ériu.
This noble warrior fights valiantly for his God and King, inspiring all those around him to do the same.
These experienced warriors have survived more than one season abroad from the fjord.
Warmongering leaders of men are little without nobles willing to serve them.
Though hailing from lands afar, a man may still put his life and weapon on the line when the coin is right.
More Saxon than Alban. Are we certain they're on our side?
Practically family, these are the king's closest retainers.
Fear, violence, plunder and reputation have made this warrior a legend among his people.
His men went to battle without armor and acted like mad dogs or wolves. They bit into their shields and were as strong as bears or bulls. They killed men, but neither fire nor iron harmed them.
For centuries, the horse-retinues of the Old North have presided over their people with eminence.
With unflinching dedication to their King, they ride through thick and thin.
A lack of experience does not mute the passion of the spearmen for their God and their tribe.
The rage and pride of Alban Highlanders comes focused on a sharpened point.
Mounted lesser-thegns defend their lord's land from foreign raiders and domestic brigands.
Danelaw spears have a fierce reputation... we hope these lads will catch on one day.
The natural defences of Northern Wales trains all men, young and old, to be proficient with a bow.
Can men stop the sun from rising or the tides of the sea from shifting? Can mortal men withstand the blows of Danelaw axes?
Any fighting force needs those who can scout and those who can procure meat.
This peerless warrior's reputation travels broadly before him. He is sure to be the victor in any holmgang for his Lord.
A foot spear to fight for their people, and their future.
Young, fresh, and still reeking of salt fish... eager all the same.
The noblemen brandish their blades to defend their King with conviction as an example to others – it is their duty.
Hurling a javelin is no easy task. Hurling it accurately, even less so. The locals should be of use.
This Alban hero becomes a whirlwind of rage, iron and gore when he puts his blade to foreign invaders.
They could probably hold their own if they stayed long enough in battle to find out.
Enemies run amok when these noble riders take to the field.
This spear-wielding champion of Mierce will follow his Lord's orders with the utmost dedication.
These warriors were armed with an iron battle axe whose powerful swings could severe a leg from the torso with a single swing.
I fear thee, ancient Mariner! I fear thy skinny hand! And thou art lank, and brown, as the ribbed sea-sand.
Yesterday, shepards. Today, slingers. Tomorrow, by God's good grace... the battle's victors.
These men stand as an unmovable bulwark when all others have fallen, fighting until either victory or death.
Even the young men of the lesser nobles will fight for the future of the kingdom.
Holy Matrimony between the Kingdom of Rheged and Northanhymbra have produced a specialised mounted Saxon group not seen among their Southern Counterparts.
Lothian Hunters are war-hardened scouts, forged by years of fighting against invaders.
Northern Saxons, much like their Southern cousins, rely primarily on their spears to carry the day.
When the North falters, a hero arises to rally the men in defense of their Kingdom from the heathens who threaten it.
